sources.title: Speech to text - OpenAI API
sources.snippet: The transcriptions API takes as input the audio file you want to transcribe and the desired output file format for the transcription of the audio. All models support the same set of input formats. On output: whisper-1 supports json, text, srt, verbose_json, and vtt. gpt-4o-transcribe and gpt-4o-mini-transcribe support json or plain text. gpt-4o-transcribe-diarize supports json, text, and ...

citation_mappings.claim_text: Yes — there are APIs that transcribe audio to text (speech-to-text / automatic speech recognition). You send audio data to the API and get back text. Common options: Major cloud API providers OpenAI Speech-to-Text API – transcribes audio files and supports multiple output formats and languages. OpenAI Platform
Google Cloud Speech-to-Text API – general purpose speech-to-text from Google Cloud. Google Cloud
Microsoft Azure Speech-to-Text (Cognitive Services) – REST API with real-time and batch transcription. Microsoft Learn

sources.title: Otter.ai wants to bring agents to all third party systems - with transcription just the start
sources.snippet:
Otter.ai has unveiled significant upgrades to its platform, introducing agentic AI features and a public API to facilitate integration with third-party enterprise systems such as CRMs (like Salesforce and HubSpot) and project management tools (such as Asana and Atlassian). These agents can both pull data from and send data to external systems, enhancing meeting automation—such as generating and inputting action items into Asana based on Zoom discussions.

The company has also introduced a model context protocol (MCP) server for interoperability with generative AI platforms like Claude and ChatGPT. Key features include automated slide capture during presentations, searchable transcripts including visual content, and advanced AI chat to explore and act upon audio or transcript data. Otter’s AI can also autonomously generate documents, schedule meetings, and keep users updated if they join meetings late.

Otter.ai emphasizes data security, offering granular controls over data sharing and HIPAA compliance. While often seen as a transcription tool, Otter positions itself as a broader enterprise workflow enhancer by building structured, searchable meeting knowledge bases. It supports collaboration platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet, and aims to improve workplace productivity through proprietary and integrated AI technologies.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Rev.ai / Otter API – transcription + features like speaker labels (Otter also offers a public API). Swiftask+1
Speechmatics – multi-language audio to text API. Swiftask
AssemblyAI – API-first transcription with extra NLP features. Geeky Gadgets
Whisper-type APIs (e.g., third-party WhisperAPI) – standard Whisper-based audio-to-text. Whisper API
Open-source alternatives you can self-host OpenAI Whisper (model) – not a hosted API but a model you can run yourself for free transcription on your own servers. fr.wikipedia.org
